filesystem

Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.DiskItem
      • filesystem.Directory

  • public class Directory
extends DiskItem
    A class of directories.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Tommy Messelis
    Invariant:
    Each directory must have proper items registered in it.
        hasProperItems()
    Note:
    The class invariants are inherited from the superclass. This means that we must also have a proper parent directory. In this class, we overwrite this checker s.t. it includes the restrictions on cycles in the file system structure.

    • Field Detail

      • items

        private final java.util.List<DiskItem> items
        Variable referencing a list collecting all items contained by this directory. The class DiskItem is responsible for controlling the bidirectional relationship. Files and directories can only be added or deleted through the constructors/destructors of File and Directory and through the move and makeRoot methods, hence the protected methods for adding and removing items from the directory
        Invariants:
      • items references an effective list.
            items != null
      • Each element in the list references an effective item.
            for each item in items:
              item != null
      • Each element in the list references a non-terminated item.
            for each item in items:
            !item.isTerminated()
      • Each element in the list (except the first element) references an item that has a name which (ignoring case) comes after the name of the immediately preceding element, in lexicographic order.
            for each I in 1..items.size() - 1:
              items.get(I).isOrderedAfter(items.get(I-1))
      • Each element in the list references an item that references back to this directory.
            for each item in items:
              item.getParentDirectory() == this
        • Note:
        This class is the non-controlling class in this relationship.

      • Directory

        @Raw
public Directory(java.lang.String name,
                      boolean writable)
        Initialize a new root directory with given name and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new directory.
        writable - The writability of the new directory.
        Postcondition:
        The new directory has no items.
            new.getNbItems() == 0
        Effect:
        The new directory is a disk item with the given name and writability.
            super(name,writable)

        @Raw
public Directory(java.lang.String name)
        Initialize a new writable root directory with given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new directory.
        Effect:
        The new root directory is initialized with the given name and is writable.
            this(name,true)

    • Method Detail

      • canBeTerminated

        public boolean canBeTerminated()
        Check whether this directory can be terminated.
        Overrides:
        canBeTerminated in class DiskItem
        Returns:
        True if the directory is not yet terminated, is writable, contains 0 items and it is either a root or its parent directory is writable
            result == getNbItems() == 0 && !isTerminated() && isWritable()
                       && (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable())
        Note:
        We have added a condition to the open spec of the superclass. Now the specification is in closed form.

      • getNbItems

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getNbItems()
        Return the number of items of this directory.

      • getItemAt

        @Basic
 @Raw
public DiskItem getItemAt(int index)
                                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Return the item registered at the given position in this directory.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item to be returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given index is not strictly positive or exceeds the number of items registered in this directory. | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Note:
        We catch the exception that could be thrown when accessing the internal representation and formulate a better suited one for the user of this class. This adds to the encapsulation of the internal representation of this class.

      • hasAsItem

        @Raw
public boolean hasAsItem(@Raw
                              DiskItem item)
        Check whether the given item is registered in this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if an item equal to the given item is registered at some position in this directory; false otherwise.
            result ==
               for some I in 1..getNbItems() :
                   (getItemAt(I) == item)

      • getInsertionIndexOf

        public int getInsertionIndexOf(@Raw
                               DiskItem item)
        Returns the potential index at which the given item would be inserted.
        Parameters:
        item - The disk item for which the index should be determined.
        Returns:
        The index at which the item should be inserted, given the ordering of the directory items.
            for each index in 1..result-1 :
             index == 1 || getItemAt(index).isOrderedBefore(item)
            for each index in result..getNbItems()+1 :
             index == getNbItems()+1 || getItemAt(index).isOrderedAfter(item)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given item is not effective or terminated | item == null || item.isTerminated()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given effective item is already present in this directory | item != null && hasAsItem(item)

      • hasProperItems

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperItems()
        Check whether this directory has valid items.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this directory can have all its items at their respective indices
            result ==
              for each I in 1..getNbItems() :
                canHaveAsItemAt(getItemAt(I),I) && getItemAt(I).getParentDirectory() == this
        Note:
        This checker ensures the consistency of the bidirectional relationship and calls another checker to check all other requirements (except this consistency).

      • canHaveAsItemAt

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItemAt(@Raw
                                    DiskItem item,
                                    int index)
        Check whether this directory can have the given item at the given index.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        index - The index to be checked.
        Returns:
        False if this directory cannot have the given item at any index or if the given index is not positive or exceeds the number of items with more than one otherwise, if the item is in this directory then true if and only if it is ordered after its predecessor and before it successor (if those exist) else true if and only if inserting the item at the given index would not result in an unordered sequence
            if (!canHaveAsItem(item)) then result == false
            else if (index < 1 || index > getNbItems() +1) then result == false
                else if (hasAsItem(item))
             then result == (index == 1 || getItemAt(index-1).isOrderedBefore(item))
             && (index == getNbItems() || getItemAt(index+1).isOrderedAfter(item))
             else result == (index == 1 || getItemAt(index-1).isOrderedBefore(item))
             && (index == getNbItems() + 1 || getItemAt(index).isOrderedAfter(item))
        Note:
        This checker checks all conditions, except the consistency of the bidirectional relationship. Here, the ordering is checked. Other restrictions on content are deferred to the canHaveAsItem checker.

      • canHaveAsItem

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItem(@Raw
                                  DiskItem item)
        Check whether this directory can have the given item as one of its items.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        If the given item is not effective or it is terminated or if this directory is terminated, then false, else if the given item is an item of this directory then true if and only if the given item has a unique name in this directory else true if and only if the name of the given item does not yet exist in this directory
            if (item == null || item.isTerminated() || this.isTerminated())
            then result == false
            else if (this.hasAsItem(item))
                then result == for one I in 1..getNbItems:
                  item.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(getItemAt(I).getName())
                else result == (!this.containsDiskItemWithName(item.getName())
        Notes:
      • This checker does not verify the consistency of the bidirectional relationship, nor the ordering in this directory.
      • This checker can be used to verify existing items in this directory, as well as to verify whether a new item can be added to this directory.

      • addAsItem

        @Model
protected void addAsItem(@Raw
                                DiskItem item)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add the given item to the items registered in this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.
        Postconditions:
      • The given item is added to the items registered in this directory.
            new.hasAsItem(item)
      • The number of items registered in this directory is incremented with 1.
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() + 1
      • All items registered in this directory, that are ordered after the given item are shifted one position to the right.
            for each I in 1..getNbItems():
              if (getItemAt(I).isOrderedAfter(item))
                then new.getItemAt(I+1) == getItemAt(I)
        • Effect:
        The new modification time of this directory is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given disk item is non-effective | item == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The item already exists in this directory | hasAsItem(item)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This directory can not have the given item as a member. | !canHaveAsItem(item)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given (effective) item does not yet refer to this directory as its parent directory | item != null && item.getParentDirectory() != this
        Note:
        This is an auxiliary method that helps set up a bidirectional relationship. It should only be called from within the controlling class. It is therefore important to restrict the use of this method as much as possible. We thus require the provided item to have set up one way of the relationship already from within the controlling class. (This means that the given item is in a raw state!)

      • addItemAt

        @Model
private void addItemAt(@Raw
                              DiskItem item,
                              int index)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Insert the given item at the given index.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.
        index - The index where the given item must be inserted.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of items registered in this directory is incremented with 1.
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() + 1
      • The given item is inserted at the given index.
            new.getItemAt(index) == item
      • All items after the given index are shifted one position to the right.
            for each I in index..getNbItems():
              new.getItemAt(I+1) == getItemAt(I)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This directory already contains the given item or cannot have it at the given index. | hasAsItem(item) || !canHaveAsItemAt(item,index)

      • removeAsItem

        @Raw
 @Model
protected void removeAsItem(DiskItem item)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given item from this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to remove
        Effects:
      • If the item was in this directory, it is removed at the position it was registered
            if (hasAsItem(item) then removeItemAt(getIndexOf(item))
      • The new modification time of this directory is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given item is non-effective | item == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given item is not in the directory | !hasAsItem(item)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given (effective) item still refers to an effective directory as its parent directory | item != null && item.getParentDirectory() != null
        Notes:
      • This is an auxiliary method that helps break off a bidirectional relationship. It should only be called from within the controlling class. It is therefore important to restrict the use of this method as much as possible. We thus require the provided item to have broken off one way of the relationship already from within the controlling class.
      • Alternatively, we could use an IllegalStateException in case the given item is not present in this directory. This depends on how you interpret the error. Is it the argument that is illegal, or is this directory in an Illegal state for the operation?

      • removeItemAt

        @Raw
 @Model
private void removeItemAt(int index)
                                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Remove the given item at the given index from this directory.
        Parameters:
        index - The index from the item to remove.
        Postconditions:
      • This directory no longer has the item at the given index as an item
            !new.hasAsItem(getItemAt(index))
      • All elements to the right of the removed item are shifted left by 1 position.
            for each I in index+1..getNbItems():
              new.getItemAt(I-1) == getItemAt(I)
      • The number of items has decreased by one
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() - 1
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - The given position is not positive or exceeds the number of items registered in this directory. | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())

      • containsDiskItemWithName

        @Raw
public boolean containsDiskItemWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether this directory contains an item with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        True if an item with the given name (ignoring case) is registered at some position in this directory; false otherwise.
            result ==
              (for some I in 1..getNbItems():
                 getItemAt(I).getName().equalsIgnoreCase(name))

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether this directory contains an item with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        True if an item with the given name (ignoring case) is registered in this directory; false otherwise.
            result == containsDiskItemWithName(name)

      • getItem

        public DiskItem getItem(java.lang.String name)
        Return the item in this directory with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item to be looked up.
        Returns:
        the item in this directory with the given name, if such an item exists null otherwise
            if (containsDiskItemWithName(name))
            then (hasAsItem(result) &&
             result.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(name))
            else result == null
        Note:
        This operation should complete in O(log(n)) time

      • getIndexOf

        public int getIndexOf(@Raw
                      DiskItem item)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the position at which the given item is registered.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be searched.
        Returns:
        The given item is registered in this directory at the resulting position.
            getItemAt(result)==item
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given item is not in the directory | ! hasAsItem(item)

      • restoreOrderAfterNameChangeAt

        @Raw
 @Model
protected void restoreOrderAfterNameChangeAt(int index)
        Restore the order of the items in this directory, given only one of them may be in the wrong position due to a name change
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item with a new name
        Postconditions:
      • this directory has proper items
            hasProperItems()
      • The index of a certain number of items has changed
            for each I in 1..getNbItems() :
              for some J in 1..getNbItems() :
                 new.getItemAt(J) == getItemAt(I)
        • Effect:
        The new modification time of this directory is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - The given index is not valid | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())

      • canHaveAsParentDirectory

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsParentDirectory(Directory directory)
        Check whether this disk directory can have the given directory as its parent directory.
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsParentDirectory in class DiskItem
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        If this directory is not terminated, and the given directory is effective and not terminated, then if the given directory is the same as this directory, then false if the given directory is a direct or indirect child of this directory, then false true otherwise
            if (!this.isTerminated() && directory != null && !directory.isTerminated())
             then result == ( this != directory && !directory.isDirectOrIndirectChildOf(this) )
        Note:
        This checker now closes the specification of the inherited checker by specifying the result in all other cases than described at the level of the superclass. In case the disk item is a directory, it is important that cycles in the file system structure are prohibited.

      • isDirectOrIndirectSubdirectoryOf

        public boolean isDirectOrIndirectSubdirectoryOf(Directory directory)
        Checks whether this directory is a direct or indirect subdirectory of the given directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this directory is a direct or indirect child of the given directory
            result == super.isDirectOrIndirectChildOf(directory)
